reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had never stayed before, but it was like meeting up with old friends again. We were made so welcome by every one on the staff, complete with a log fire in the reception area on the snowy day we arrived. Our room was lovely - spacious and very warm. Our evening meal was just wonderful perfectly cooked and served from the best attentive staff possible. Coudn't wait to see what was for breakfast and it didn't disappoint. Can't wait for our next visit.
reviews.title: Romantic Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We only stayed overnight, but long enough to get a good feel of the place. Well located for Stratford and easy to get to Birmimgham and the cathedral cities along the M5. Architecturally interesting and visually very pleasing with spacious public rooms downstairs but narrow corridors and a horrible carpet upstairs. A wonderful setting for a wedding. With one glaring exception (more later) the service was professional and personable and we were made to feel we were important to them. Excellent value for money - our second handpicked hotel stay - so a good deal with champagne and canapes before dinner. The food was of a very high standard with plenty of choice. Wine was reasonably priced (I suppose!).
reviews.title: nearly perfect

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We chose an executive room which is a basic room with a lovely view of the grounds and ruins. Spacious with high ceilings and a decent sized bathroom. The furniture was large and the huge blanket box detracted rather than added anything to the room. Our one complaint was that breakfast took almost an hour and a half. Nearly 30 minutes to get coffee. We chose a busy time but still not good enough.
reviews.title: Haunting

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Would I recommend it? Yes, but give yourselves plenty of time in the morning.
reviews.title: Weekend Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As a lover of all things Gothic, this has been one of my favourite buildings since I first saw it in the original Julie Harris film The Haunting but as a hotel it has never quite done it for me. The new management however has worked wonders and the fusty 1970s decor has been stripped away; it's now like staying in a stately home belonging to your affable aunt.
reviews.title: What a weekend!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled with friends
reviews.text: We stayed at Ettingham Park Hotel from 6th to 8th September 2010 and thought it was perfect. From the moment we arrived the staff were always on hand, friendly and nothing was too much trouble. Our rooms were large with everything one would expect from a 4 star hotel and more. The food in the restaurant was delicious and well presented and the setting was just breathtaking. I would definately recommend this hotel if you want a quiet and elegant stay in beautiful surroundings.
reviews.title: Superb hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We felt the location and setting was lovely but the hotel did not live up to expectations. Bed was rock hard and executive room 'functional' rather than luxury. Food acceptable, wines overpriced. Felt hotel was like a ship without a rudder. No Management visible!
reviews.title: Disappointing.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We are ex-hoteliers and widely travelled.
reviews.title: Above and beyond all expectations!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I booked a night at the Ettington Park for my boyfriends birthday. We stayed on the DBB champagne and canapes offer. I was expecting something pretty special having seen all the pictures and descriptions of this hotel on various websites but nonetheless I was a little anxious that the stay was going to be as special as I hoped. On arrival I was very pleased...Everything was at it looked in the pictures - just beautiful! We had a lovely room with a fantastic view of the chapel. We spent some time exploring the grounds and then took a dip in the pool. However little did we know but the best was yet to come! Our evening in the hotel was fantastic. The food was delicious. I have a very healthy appetite and I found the portions to be fine (unlike some reviews on here). However, it has to be said that the staff were the ones who made the evening what it was. Nothing was too much trouble, so accomodating and made my boyfriend's birthday everything I had hoped it would be for him! We enjoyed after dinner drinks in the magnificant bar area...the setting is just so special. Thank you to all the staff at Ettington Park, you really did a lovely job. I can't wait to return!
reviews.title: Loveley break and great value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed on the £200 offer (dinner; bed; and breakfast) as a getaway from London for a night. The hotel had all the character that we were hoping for; and more importantly there was no indication that we were on 'an offer' like you get in some hotels. From check in to check out, the staff were friendly and attentive. The creme tea; dinner; and breakfast were all really tasty and excellent quality. We had a relaxing time; felt like we were looked after; and all at very good value. A great break and we would highly recommend it to all.
reviews.title: Exceeded expectations
Nice hotel, fab location, great breakfast
reviews.text: Lovely set hotel with a lovely drive leading to the entrance. Me and my wife have stayed here once before As wedding guests , we enjoyed. Much we decided to come back!

reviews.title: Ettington Weekend
reviews.text: On arrival there was a very warm atmosphere everywhere we went throughout the hotel. Quick check in and a warm pot of tea with the homemade biscuits sure helped to warm you up !

reviews.title: Wedding weekend
reviews.text: The room with the piano we found to be cold at times along with the waiters in the restaurant.

reviews.title: Great experience at friends Wedding
reviews.text: Attitudes seem to be dull along with poor attention to our needs we endlessly had to ask for our rather over priced wine to be poured . Along with a long wait between courses i decided to nip outside into the cold for a cigarette as the wait proved to be tedious. One waiter particular stood out rather tall a little plump and i think his name was Matthew he seemed not at all bothered about our needs and needless to say he seemed down right arrogant with no apparent urge to clear away our empty plates. We did not feel as welcome in the dining room as check in.

reviews.title: Excellent venue
reviews.text: Our pot of tea was served with more care.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Had a fantastic two night break between Christmas and New Year. Booked because we love the 1963 film “The Haunting” which was filmed here, it also featured in several episodes of the 1960’s programme “Danger Man”. Also just a short drive away from Stratford-upon-Avon or Warwick.
reviews.title: Best Hotel We've Stopped In

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Amazing building in lovely grounds. When arriving we had to stop the car because a deer was in the middle of the road, a lovely start to our holiday. Checking in was friendly and efficient. Damien showed us to our room, very friendly, helpful and knowledgeable about the history of the hotel. Booked a Classic room (Room 20) which was spacious (as was the bathroom) and spotlessly clean. Bed was very comfy, best nights sleep we've had in a hotel for ages. Had a lovely walk in the grounds (they even supply wellington boots in the snow if you need them). All members of staff were pleasant and made the effort to talk to us and ask us about our stay and also on several occasions went out of their way to give us a guided tour of parts of the hotel we would otherwise not have seen. Talking to one of the waiters at dinner, when he realised we were interested in the history he immediately disappeared and re-appeared shortly with a guide for us to read and take home with us. One waiter asked if we had seen The Long Gallery and when we said no he immediately went and found someone to open it up for us who also gave us a history of the hotel. Another waiter asked us if we would like to see the Chapel and again he was also able to tell us about its history. So nice to find that all staff seemed to work well as a team but also had a real interest in the hotel.
reviews.title: Fantastic Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Dinner the first night did seem chaotic. We had booked a table for 7.00 but it was 8.00 before our starters arrived. Have a feeling we had been forgotten because suddenly two glasses of champagne arrived with the waiter apologising for the delay with our starters. Having said that the food was well worth waiting for and is of an exceptionally high standard and this was the only delay we experienced in two nights of dining. Breakfasts were excellent, fresh food, well cooked, efficient service. Taking afternoon tea in the Drawing Room on a cold winter’s afternoon was a real treat.
reviews.title: Wonderful location and beautiful building, pity about the food.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We will definitely be returning in the future and it’s a pity more hotels do not have staff like the ones at Ettington Park. They really did make the holiday special. Only disappointment was we did not see any ghosts!
reviews.title: Perfect Place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Took my wife here for her birthday, staff couldn't do enough, rooms luxurious, food fantastic, leisure facility superb.
reviews.title: A brilliant hotel that comes up just short (given the price)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: For those of you who are wondering whether Ettington Park is a good choice for a break/ surprise or just a night away from the 'hustle and bustle', I would certainly recommend it for any of these. The property is exquisite and extremely individual, the surroundings are truly relaxing and beautiful. You can go for a nice walk around the grounds, stop for a cheeky drink in the lounge or simply choose from one of the dvd's they have in their library to watch in your room. The rooms are equipped with everything you could wish for and are very clean and modern. The food is fantastic whether you are ordering room service or eating in the restaurant, nothing is too much trouble for the staff. It was nice to go to a hotel which lived up to my expectations (us ladies do seem to have high levels of these as you men know)!
reviews.title: A perfect getaway

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I loved Ettington and would certainly return again!
reviews.title: Beautifull hotel

likes.liked: — Friendly staff, lovely location, very relaxing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.title: An absolute gem

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled on business
reviews.text: What a beautifull elegent hotel. We were given this as a christmas present by relatives 2006 and booked may 2007. From the moment you arrive you are made to feel at home, very relaxed informal atmosphere, nothing is too much trouble for the staff who go out of there way to make your stay a one to remember. Was lovely to walk round the grounds and sit in the sun on the terrace drinking coffee.Lovely spotless clean rooms and very comfortable beds, breakfast was very good too. Didn't want to leave as felt very relaxed, would love to come back soon. Dont be put off by negative reviews, must be very fussy people.Defaintly a 10/10 for us.
reviews.title: First Class Service
marvellous
reviews.text: After considering many different venues for our wedding, including Coombe Abbey and Ragley Hall, my wife and I opted for Ettington Park Hotel. It was perfect:

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Having now stayed at 7 handpicked hotels, i would say that they all have their own individual charms. The only common factor is that the staff can't do enough for you. We have always been lucky enough to stay in the original houses and our rooms have always been spectacular. I wouldn't hesitate to stay in any hotels within this group.
reviews.title: Fantastic hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: Ettington is a beautiful breathtaking property. From the moment we arrived there was a staff member waiting to take our bags for us (thanks Damien!) The room itself was a suite overlooking the chapel and was spotless. A room you wouldn't want to leave.
reviews.title: Perfect weekend

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had dinner here and the food was good. The breakfast as always was delicious with plenty of choice.
reviews.title: Peaceful and charming, but needs some improvement in the housekeeping department.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Would return here in an instant. Well done again handpicked!!
reviews.title: Left us a bit confused

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Absolutely perfect. There is nothing i can fault. I went for a family members wedding which took place in the hotel. We had a free bar all day and night. My room was luxurious and spacious. The staff looked after each and every one of us. The sit down meal they served us was outstanding and they never let our glasses get empty. The surrounding is beautiful and scenery just perfect with sheep, rabbits and horses. If your thinking or know someone who is thinking about wedding packages i would highly advise this hotel. You will not be let down.
reviews.title: My favourite hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010
reviews.text: We stayed at this wonderful hotel for pur honeymoon in October 2010. We had a beautiful suite overlooking the beautiful gardens. The room was very high standard, bathroom luxurious and all great.
reviews.title: A wonderful place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: The pool, sauna, and steam room were just perfect and the jacuzzi was great, a fabulous bubble bath.
reviews.title: Mixed Experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had room service for breakfast, which was superb, a wide choice of continental and traditional English cooked breakfasts.
reviews.title: Stunning Hotel, delicious food, great value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our overall stay was wonderful and we cannot wait to return...
reviews.title: an excellent stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel buildings and grounds are impressive. The room was tastefully decorated and furnished except for the oversize flat screen TV. The bathroom was spacious and well equipped.
reviews.title: Nothing like it used to be

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at this lovely "out of the way pastoral beauty " from Aug 6th -9th, 2007. We enjoyed the elegant Stour Suite for the duration of our stay. The suite was beautiful, views amazing with floor to ceiling windows on two sides. Decor was a well thought out blend of period furniture and modern comfort .Front desk staff were friendly, efficient and consistently helpful and responsive to any of our questions. Porter staff, bar staff, pleasant, inobstrusive, and always available to guests. We enjoyed breakfast all three days in bed, delicious, hot and brought to our room as ordered and on time each day. Afternoon tea was delightful, a real highlight for us Canadians who rarely get to enjoy authentic devon cream and scones. We ate only one evening at Ettington Park and although we cannot find fault with the quality of the food served we were dissappointed with the nonchalent wait staff. We were one of only four tables dining in the dining room that night, but one would have thought the dining room was full given the mediocre service. Enough said on this issue, one staff member should not take away from the overall fabulous experience we had during our stay at this beautifully preserved English Manor house. The grounds of this gem are perfectly manicured, and you can get a tour of the orginal chapel ruins from the Gardiner on request. There is a lovely pool for hotel guests, but never had the opportunity to enjoy it. This hotel is as equally perfect for that quiet /romantic get-away as it is for those who are looking for an upscale place to rest their heads while visiting the Cotswalds, Stratford-upon-Avon and their environs.
reviews.title: Elegant Ettington!

likes.liked: — a wonderful eclectic staff, beautiful location, amazing ambiance

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our stay was from a Monday-Thursday so we cannot comment on other Trip Advisor reports of unpleasant stays on weekends due to private/corporate events. We suspect one may want to reconsider staying here if there is a private event such as a wedding going on as it would be difficult to find privacy in the common areas of the hotel given its' lay out if that is what you were wanting.
reviews.title: best hotel ever stayed in

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our stay was spectacular, cannot thank the hotel staff enough for all their efforts, and would highly recommend this hotel. Would stay here again, based on this experience.
reviews.title: 25 years on

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is beautiful!!!!!! We booked this hotel for our 1st Wedding Anniversary and it was perfect, we couldn't believe how the staff are genuinly nice and are all so helpful and just nice all the time but not over the top. When we arrived at the hotel we could not beleive our eyes, this hotel is haunted which is one of the reasons we picked it, the hotel had such a nice feeling about it. We had an excutive room which was lovely the best hotel room I have ever stayed in and I use too work for a hotel company so I have been to lots of hotels. The standard rooms are also very nice. Look on a website called hand picked hotel.com and you will see this hotel and realise what I am talking about. The food is wonderful, we had dinner bed & breakfast, the dinner was so nice and the breakfast was wonderful too as you had every single thing to choose from so you would never be stuck on what to eat, the service was out of this world too. For the people who have typed negative things about this hotel do not be put off as those people have got it all
reviews.title: Disappointing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: wrong and must be very very very very fussy. I am sorry if I am going on but this was our first wedding anniversary and we wanted it to be so special and this hotel certainly did this for us. Do not be put off with the price as its worth every penny. We are going to go back again very soon.
reviews.title: Charming hotel close to Stratford
What a wonderful experience
reviews.text: My wife and I just returned from a month long trip to Europe and had the pleasure of staying at Ettington park during our UK swing We found the property so interesting that we feel compelled to write this longish review.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Before we left the US my wife had gone on line and booked a night at Ettington Park which looked interesting and was about where we wanted to begin our weeklong tour of the UK and Scotland countryside.
reviews.title: Where were the ghosts then ????

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Upon arrival at Ettington we were immediately impressed and excited. The drive up to the property was exquisite and we knew before we walked in that we would like the property. The greeting by the staff as well as all of the interaction we had with them was amazing.
reviews.title: well worth a visit

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: As a matter of fact, when we were talking with Catherine at the front desk, and in conversation, mentioned that we had no plans after here other than to tour the countryside while working our way up to Edinburgh it was she who recommended that we consider staying at some of the other properties owned by this hotel group (we did not even know there were others). She ended up booking us in at Wood Hall, Norton House and Rookery Hall.
reviews.title: Simply the Best!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Without going into extensive detail we had the opportunity to stay and dine at each of these hotels and found them each unique and wonderful in their own way (Ettington was our favorite, definitely the best staff).
reviews.title: nice hotel....BUT

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I booked a two night stay - dinner, bed and breakfast - as part of my husband's birthday present and a break from the usual daily grind. I could not have asked for more. The beautiful surroundings, outstanding architecture, and the friendly, professionalism of all the staff made our stay a first-class break.
reviews.title: A First-Class Break
Simply Excellent
reviews.text: We had the pool area to ourselves each afternoon, which I assume was a bonus of staying out of season, the room was spotless and the meal choices were more than enough for us.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were greeted by all staff by our name, and there was always someone on hand to answer questions and give help with a history of the building. Although we did not encounter the ghosts, the building was a joy to explore.
reviews.title: Pull your socks up

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Although I am fully aware that the staff could be pushed to the limit during a busy season, we cannot praise enough the individual service which we received, even given the conferences and family bookings which were happening during our stay. Extra praise must go to the lovely man who looked after us in the restaurant at dinner and breakfast, who's quietly spoken attention to detail made us feel very special.
reviews.title: Eccentric but welcoming

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled on business
reviews.text: In all, I would stay here again without a moment's hesitation.
reviews.title: Grand hotel - but won't cost that much to stay in!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We used to stay Hand Picked Hotels regularly but not for some time and never before at Ettingham Park. Last year we stayed a New Hall in Sutton Coldfield where the food was dreadful and we left with the impression that the hotel was being run on a shoestring. So much so we felt Hand Picked had had its day so we gave the group a wide berth.
reviews.title: So good we extended our stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled with family
reviews.text: It was only when I received an email from them stating that my "Loyalty" points were due to expire that I booked a two night break at Ettingham Park.
reviews.title: Tea and comfort

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We arrived after a dreadful journey through blizzards and very heavy traffic feeling utterly stressed. Despite the rain lashing down, Pete, Ettingham Park's wonderful elderly concierge, came out to greet us and take our suitcase from the car and took us through to Reception where a lovely Canadian lady checked us in. She was so welcoming and told us about the house. It really did feel like we had arrived at a stately home rather than a hotel.
reviews.title: Actually it was very good.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had paid for a room upgrade but as Gold card members of the Hand Picked Loyalty Club, the hotel upgraded us again to the Victoria Garden Suite which really is quite stunning. The room is a large open plan bedroom and sitting room with the most spectacular views over the grounds of the hotel. It was beautifully equipped with everything you would expect from a luxury hotel. Each day a small bottle of fresh milk was left in the fridge and biscuits were replenished. Often hotels just top up the tea bags and UHT milk but this was not the case at Ettingham Park, whatever you used, it was replaced.
reviews.title: Perfect for a romantic getaway
AJSOT
reviews.text: The food at Ettingham Park is really superb, the A La Carte menu is really enticing. The quality of the ingredients and presentation of all the dinners we ate there were exceptionally good. The service in the restaurant and bar was exemplary, even on Valentines night when the hotel was full and three dining rooms were occupied, the service didn’t falter.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It is a lovely Hotel. The grounds were lovely; we played croquet on the lawn. The Room was in the "new" section and was basically a city lodge style room added to the old hall. The corridors smelt like smoke constantly.
reviews.title: Lovely Hotel and Grounds but Over Expensive

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My problem with the experience was the cost of simply things. In the bar before our meal, we were offered drinks. Fine we had 2 Pims. We did not receive a bill the waiter said he can add it to our room bill. Later I returned to the little bar and noticed no list of drinks and prices and ordered a pint and another Pims. Guess the cost, £12.00 for two drinks honestly that was over the top. At dinner we had a bottle of wine as at £15 a bottle it seemed a better option than individual drinks.
reviews.title: Fabulous Ettington Park

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: When we checked out I noticed that the Pims of the previous day totalled £15. That’s a joke.
reviews.title: A 'classic' not a 'plastic' hotel

likes.disliked: — A somewhat restricted lounge & bar area if you're sharing with a wedding.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A lovely hotel but unless you have money to burn watch what you spend. The new wing rooms will disappoint you.
reviews.title: Ettington Park Hotel- The perfect getaway
